answers.answer: p.s....my consultant is a pregnancy/fetal specialist.iv been under his care since 2009 when i found my baby had gross abnormalities  anyway he knows iv had protein for at least 2 yrs almost straight! We both thiught qit was purely b/c i was preg that my kidneys couldnt cope with extra waste(not sue if protein was present in 09.may b i could find ou) i went to see consultant about pcr results.only he wernt there so i seen some other lady doc who was more intrested in talking to my partner about the price per m2 for her extention(he was in work gear) when i got home b/c i was none the wiser i checked my note and in the back where blood an urine results from lab are kept i seen the heqding read: **ckd ks1 if other evidence of renal damage is present**Astricks anall.i rang gp to discus as if frightend me.i cant remember what he said but he palmed me off! Thats y i was looking in to ckd..i know protein isnt the only/sure sign of renal damage or disease but surely to have such high readings for so long deserves more tests than blood an urine over and over again.plus ur kidneys dont leak protein for nothing do they? Xx so much for short story :/

Hello and hope you are doing well.Understand your predicament. The most common cause of proteinuria is kidney damage resulting from diabetes and hypertension. Others could be due to urinary tract infections, immune disorders, trauma and cancer. Some of the chronic infections such as tuberculous kidney may require (IVU / IVP) intravenous pyelography / urography for diagnosis (as well as urine culture for tubercle bacilli.). Discuss these options with your consulting doctor.He will ask for blood tests, urine culture, an x ray and an ultra sonogram of the abdomen. Sometimes he may ask for an Intravenous pyelogram and a CT scan.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.
thanks for the reply...iv recived an appt for an ultrasound scan on 12 feb.will keep u posted x

Hi, I had ACR test, 1st one was 98, the last one I just had was 198.  It is the amount of protein in your urine vs the creatine.  It like mine very abnormal.  I have just recently had kidney bloods done, and a kidney ultrasound.  All normal.  But i know they cant see filters on an ultrasound (they are too small) they were doing it to rule out tumours! I go back to my doctors this week, she said I will probably be referred to renal clinic, spilling protein through your kidneys will damage them more, so my GP said it needs to be sorted.  It can be caused by a number of other diseases, so they tested my for Lupus, Diabeatis, other autoimmune disorders, all normal.  So they are thinking its a primary disease of the kidneys itself.  I dont know for sure yet.  I did have heart failure through pregnancy and maybe thats caused some permanent damage.  I notice you live in Warrington.... I do too!Make sure you follow it up, protein isnt good for the kidneys at all, need to find out the cause and get medication to help, especially if you are young.

Me again! ACR stands for Albumin Creatine Ratio, Albumin is the Protein found in the urine.  I also have swelling of my eyes something in the AM too.  The filters of your kidneys shouldnt let protein through, as the protein molecules are too big to fit through the holes! they act like a sive.  If the filters are damaged by some disease they allow protein through that is needed in you blood, it can get worse over time and the underlying issue needs addressing.  IS you urine foamy?  mine is at times, the protein makes it foamy, thats how I knew I had protein in my urine so I went the doctors.

Sorry im not gettinh emails..Wow what a small world.im talking to folk on 'kidney friends' but there all on otherside of the world.my wee is 'foamy' but id describe it as bubbles not foam haha...anyway....i just got my appt for the neph,begining sept..i was sick of being told my bloods are normal.so i went to see MY gp.hes really black an white about everything.i asked him to give me some acctual numbers from lab.he said my gfr was 97 last sept lasts weeks was 62! Hi, I have just got back from my GP, she has given me a referral for a neph, I am going to ring in a minute and book it, my scan and bloods are all normal too, my urine spill over 24hrs was 350g or 0.350mg  She said average is 0- 0.1g.  Not sure if my heart problems has caused this or not, my heart is recovered now. that is just my Guess!   I just hope they get to the bottom of it and and its nothing sinister.

I know my numbers, they always tell me the results anyway....They know how paranoid i get about my health! She said they will send all the info to the nephrologist. My function function eGFR was over 90% so normal, but you can still have kidney disease going on with your kidneys remain normal for a while. Eventually the protein will affect them, so they may put me on an ACE inhibitor to reduce protein, I've look these before when I was in heart failure, they are used for the heart as well. I understand they can also protect the kidney. I have been spilling the protein for past two years since my child's birth, and kidney function has remained normal at present. I know it was reduced to 75% during preeclampsia.GP said the neph may do a biopsy. My concern was it was being caused by some other sinister underlying condition, but all my bloods are normal, so really don't know what's causing it. Hopefully will find out.Sorry your function has declined I hope you get it sorted soon. How do you feel?

I think they will put me on ace too.my appt is i think 10th sept(really need to double check) ill let you kno.have you had your appt yet?

Has anyone checked your thyroid?  Especially since this occurred around pregnancy, hormones affect it and thyroid can affect the kidneys.  Drs often don't look at the whole person, I would have it checked too and find out the numbers they get, don't let them blow off a little high as OK, because you still feel awful.
Thanks for comment..yes thyroid and diabites an all other bloods are normal.

Stop making me pee an do something else if not just to rule it out :-\ last 3 weeks i have started to feel nauseous.i went to bed feeling sick when i woke i swiched night light on and i had a black dot over my right pupil.my mum said that can be high blood preasure.so can u be diagnosed with ckd if no swelling or high bp? Tia for any replys
